compass.title: Voter Compass
compass.disclaimer: This questionnaire helps you find the political party or election coalition that best matches your views based on their program. To make a final choice, it’s also worth looking into the candidates’ past reliability and actions. If you don’t make a choice, it may give an advantage to the most popular party.
compass.resultsHelp: How much you agree with the party’s positions

questions.1: Should city districts have more decision-making power and their own budgets?
questions.2: Should the processing of building permits and detailed plans be significantly accelerated?
questions.3: Should residents have more opportunities to participate in city decisions (public consultations, participatory budgeting, discussions)?
questions.4: Should the city publish all major decisions and contracts, including in machine-readable form?
questions.5: Should the city halt new infrastructure projects until additional studies and analyses are done?
questions.6: Does the membership of city officials in political party leadership bodies affect the objectivity of city governance?
questions.7: Should the city build more municipal rental apartments at affordable prices?
questions.8: Should the city increase support for renovating private and apartment buildings (facades, energy efficiency)?
questions.9: Should reducing land tax and local taxes in Tallinn be a priority?
questions.10: Should free public transport continue in Tallinn?
questions.11: Should the night public transport network and frequency be increased?
questions.12: Should car traffic in the city centre be reduced?
questions.13: Should developing public urban space for people be prioritized even if it reduces space for cars?
questions.14: Should the city be responsible for snow and ice removal on sidewalks and cycle paths?
questions.15: Should all kindergartens and schools in Tallinn be Estonian-language?
questions.16: Should kindergarten be free starting from the first child?
questions.17: Should the city build more kindergartens and schools to reduce class sizes?
questions.18: Should the city prioritize preserving green areas and parks over new developments?
questions.19: Should investments in Tallinn’s district heating and energy infrastructure focus more on renewable energy?
questions.20: Instead of social benefits, should the city invest more in job creation and developing social services?
questions.21: Should the city open more community centers and fund local initiatives?
questions.22: Should the city invest more in organizing major international events and festivals?
questions.23: Should the city officially support a nightlife development plan and a 24-hour city strategy?
questions.24: Should the city limit immigration and foreign citizens’ participation in local communities?
questions.25: Should the city support new immigrants and cosmopolitan multicultural development?
questions.26: Should Tallinn invest more in tourism development to boost the local economy?
questions.27: Should the city offer more tax incentives and simpler conditions for small and start-up businesses?
questions.28: Should the city create a dedicated fund or program to support innovation and start-ups?
